newsitem.title: UK: Sinn Fein's Adams hails IRA truce.
newsitem.headline: Sinn Fein's Adams hails IRA truce.

text.p: Gerry Adams, president of the IRA's political wing, Sinn Fein, said on Saturday that the ceasefire by his guerrilla allies was a momentous step.

"In Sinn Fein's view, the decision by the IRA is a momentous one and I want to commend the IRA's leadership for having the courage to take that forward looking decision, " Adams told a news conference.

Adams called upon Northern Ireland's Unionist parties, which want to keep the province British, to "seize the moment" at Northern Ireland peace talks to which Sinn Fein can now be admitted after the IRA truce.

He said British Prime Minister Tony Blair had a special responsibility to steer the talks towards a settlement of a 28-year conflict which has killed 3,200. He urged Blair "to be part of the partnership for peace which must be brought about and which must be consolidated to have a democratic peace settlement."
